results.description:
This 2 bedroom flat is in a brilliantly convenient location only a 15 minute walk from Elephant and Castle station providing excellent transport links in and around London. The apartment has a lovely living room with dining area, a fully equipped kitchen, two comfy bedrooms and an immaculate bathroom. There is even a private garden, in case you smoke (no smoking indoor).
Bermondsey Street, Borough Market, London Bridge, Tower Bridge are all within 15 minutes walking distance! PETS FRIENDLY
results.neighborhood_overview:
Walworth is a central district in the London Borough of Southwark. This area is in the process of serious regeneration and gentrification.

The Artworks Elephant near Elephant & Castle station, is a trendy box park made of second-hand shipping containers - there are bars, cafÃ©s and restaurants on the ground floor, including tiny French eateries. It additionally functions as a creative hub with two floors of studios and a temporary council library.

Classic and newer release films are currently being shown by Backyard Cinema at Mercato Metropolitano, a huge indoor food venue and Italian supermarket in Newington Causeway.

Bermondsey Street and its trendy bars are 5 mins away. Borough Market and its food stalls is 15 mins away, by walk.

The local council swimming pool and gym is at The Castle Centre in Elephant & Castle.

The East Street Market off Walworth Road, known locally as "The Lane", is a busy general market selling everything

It is fully furnished with everything ready to provide an enjoyable and comfortable stay. There is free unlimited wifi access and unlimited Netflix. There is woodstrip flooring throughout.
results.neighborhood_overview:
Fitzrovia is a very desirable trendy, arty and foodie top location, in the heart of the West End in Central London. It's a wonderful and safe area with lots going on. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs and supermarkets.

The neighbourhood has a villagey feel and some beautiful Georgian architecture. It was was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today Fitzrovia is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a vibrant buzz.
results.host_about:
We are Liz and Jack.  We manage a number of holiday let properties in Fitzrovia, central London and Lymington, as well as many long let properties. We look forward to welcoming you one of our super  home from homes.

We know Fitzrovia well and can thoroughly recommend it for its central London location, great transport links (although you'll probably be mostly on foot as tourist London is very walkable!) and wide choice of bars and restaurants. It's a highly desirable neighbourhood with beautiful architecture and interesting streets. People come from all over London to enjoy some Fitzrovia life. We're lucky enough to be based here and hope to see you here too! 

When we want to head out of the city, Lymington is our favourite getaway location. You'll love this quaint seaside town on the edge of the beautiful New Forest. 

We have been letting our properties for over 15 years. We hope we've perfected a warm and professional welcome. Really importantly, you can book with us worry-free. As you'll see from our vast number of reviews, we offer a friendly, guest-focused, helpful and absolutely reliable service.  

We're very happy to help with questions (before or during your stay) or to tailor any trip to suit your needs so just let us know if there's anything we can do. We look forward to seeing you in London or Lymington!

results.description: Artist house, bright high ceiling rooms for both the bedroom and office, a communal garden in a conservation area near Battersea Park. Bedroom with double bed (160x200) and a separate dressing room/exercise area. The other double height room is used as a studio/office with a desk, chair and large standing height table. results.neighborhood_overview:
- Battersea is a quiet family area, easy access to Battersea Park and Clapham Junction/Lavender Hill for restaurants and shops. Walk across the bridge and you will be in Chelsea or Fulham. There are plenty of direct bus routes to central London.
- Ideally located if you are in town for events in the Battersea Park (Affordable Art Fair) or the Chelsea Flower Show
- Clapham Junction is perfect if you are arriving from Gatwick Airport. Direct bus from South Kensington tube station if arriving from Heathrow Airport or 30min journey by car.
results.host_about:

Paolo is an artist and most of the works in our homes are his. I travel often for work in the field of brand marketing.

When making a booking request, please share with us a little bit more about yourselves and the purpose of your trip/stay. We rent out our private home so I hope you can understand. Thank you.

results.name: Comfy Family Home in London
results.description: We have a comfortable, child friendly, family home in the wonderful area of Stoke Newington. Stoke Newington is a very sought after place to live in London. It's got a village feel to it with lots of families.
results.neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is a fabulous location in London, with quick and easy transport links to the centre of town. It's got a village feel, a community vibe which can be unusual for London. 3 min walk to Clissold Park, a large park with a big brand new playground, animal sanctuary, brand new cafe, ponds, tennis courts, skate park, leisure centre. There are lots of lovely shops, cafes and excellent restaurants.
results.host_about: My husband Joby and I live here with our 2 daughters age 15 and 18. We have a labradoodle dog called Lenny and a cat named Prince Nelson. Joby works in Radio and I am a complimentary therapist and life coach.  Joby is very into his music and art, I have a regular meditation and yoga practice.  We are very social, we love being outdoors, having fun.  We choose not to have a car in London as you really don't need it.  We cycle everywhere and use the buses, trains and underground.  The kids have their own bikes too.  Our favourite local restaurants are Rasa - Indian vegetarian restaurant (you must try it!) and Testis - our local Turkish food (the best!). We are quite active, swimming at our local pool, going for jogs around the park.  We love traveling where there are places to swim outdoors.  We love camping near the sea or lakes.  I am from Vancouver, Canada so we spend every other summer travelling around the Gulf Islands of British Columbia.

results.name: The Residential Suite Above Gallery
results.description: A lovely 1 bedroom flat above an art gallery in the heart of Victoria Park Village. Steps from artisan cafÃ©s, traditional pubs, organic grocers, fine quality fish monger and independent boutique shops. Easy access to transport with 3 frequent bus services. Next door to beautiful Victoria Park with boating lake and flourishing gardens.
results.neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood "Victoria Park Village" is absolutely charming with independent boutiques, pubs, organic fine grocers, and excellent restaurants. Highly recommended is a walk through the vast and stunning "Victoria Park" (aka "People's Park") which is London's oldest public park (est. 1845). It contains 2 lakes, tennis courts, row boats, cafÃ©s, Victorian monuments, and lush gardens. A 10min. walk down Victoria Park Road will lead you to Broadway Market in the super trendy area of London Fields. Every Saturday the market is bustling with gourmet food traders, street musicians, fashions, and excitement. Sunday is a great day to visit the food market in Victoria Park or walk to Columbia Road Market to take amazing photos of the floral explosion! . Victoria Park Village is the perfect place for an authentic experience of life as a Londoner!
results.host_about: Greetings! I'm Ingrid, a Canadian born Londoner, art gallery director, and the creative heart behind this urban oasis. I'm excited to welcome you to my village-like haven in a bustling iconic city. For over a decade now, my journey as a host has been fuelled by my deep love for travel, my genuine desire to connect with people, and to share insider tips and personalised recommendations. Art & culture are my specialty. Your adventure starts here!

results.name: CHARMING FAMILY HOME
results.description: A typical Victorian Terraced London house, colourfully decorated, comfortable and homely. This is a friendly, quiet neighbourhood street with plenty of nearby restaurants, takeaways and great transport links right into the centre of London.  Westfield one of Europe's largest urban shopping malls is on our doorstep. You get to feel like a local living in London but still with easy access to all the tourist areas. Convenient for airports & Eurostar
results.neighborhood_overview:
Shepherds Bush itself is a prime real estate location. It is among one of the most diverse neighbourhoods in London with convenience stores and multi ethnic restaurants just around the corner from the house.

Shepherds Bush is one of London best linked transport hubs giving guests easy access to Central London, the major airports, North, West and South- West Britain.

Shepherds Bush Green is a short walk or even shorter bus ride away from our home and is a bustling metropolitan centre with market, theatres, cinemas, music venues, gyms, night clubs, and the massive Westfield Shopping Mall with its comprehensive shopping ranging from Tiffany to Marks and Spencer, Prada to the Disney Store.

The BBC Television Centre is also just around the corner with its new high end restaurants, Soho House and TV studios. The London College of Fashion and the University of The Arts is also based in Shepherds Bush making this area popular with media types and fashion folk
results.host_about:
We are Elisa and Dominic and we live in West London. For the past 20 years Elisa has been a yoga instructor, teaching private and group classes mainly in Kensington and Notting Hill. Dominic is a professional sailor who also does renovation work when not at sea. Together have 5 children aged between 25 and 33 - who have all now flown the nest.

We enjoy people, sunshine, sailing and family. We run yoga and sailing holidays around the world including regular retreats in Kerala in India, UK, Turkey, Italy, Greece and Spain.
We have been hosting guests in the spare bedroom in our home since 2010 and it has proved to be a really enjoyable experience. 

We have enjoyed meeting so many people from all over the world and getting to know them a little during their stays with us. 

We have ourselves been guests in a number of Airbnb home rentals  in Iceland, Wales, France and Spain. 

There is something rather special about staying in a less touristy location and experiencing a place with the personal touch of staying in a home with local people as their guests rather than a generic hotel room. However we also understand the importance of retaining that sense of privacy we all appreciate.

For many years we used to swap homes with other families in Europe & the US. We enjoyed the mutual respect between ourselves and our exchange partners to be respectful of each other's property.  When in the summer of 2012 London hosted the Olympics, Airbnb encouraged their â€˜spare roomâ€™ hosts to rent out their whole home to visitors coming to the city.  It wasnâ€™t uncharted territory for us to trust strangers to look after our home so we decided to give it a try.  

Even with the financial exchange involved, we have enjoyed a trusting relationships with our guests. They understand that this is our family home and not an impersonal investment rental property.  Itâ€™s been great to hear their feedback as to how much they have enjoyed living in our diverse London neighbourhood and weâ€™ve truly appreciated the pride consecutive guests have taken in looking after our home. 

This positive experience encourages us to continue to rent our home as part of a lifestyle shift that we have embarked upon in recent years.  

We have regularly house/pet sat for friends, neighbours and extended family. Now when our home is rented we take on short, medium and long term housesits in the UK and Europe.

results.description:
Welcome to my place! I offer a large room in a renovated flat, with contemporary dÃ©cor. The room is airy and spacious, with plenty of natural light and very comfortable.

Please read the listing info in full.

Located in a residential road, the flat is just 8 min walk from Queens Road Peckham station, on the Overground and mainline trains. There are several buses going to Town and Victoria. Peckham itself is a vibrant and fashionable area with plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants minutes away!
results.neighborhood_overview:
Peckham itself is a vibrant and fashionable area, and there are plenty of good cafes, bars and restaurants across the area. Peckham is thhe London neighborhood that has been voted one of the coolest in the world.

Frankâ€™s CafÃ© on Rye Lane, provided the gold standard for the Peckham renaissance. Open every summer, it occupies the top floor of a former multistorey car park, welcoming children and dogs with alacrity, and staff hand out blankets on chillier evenings.

The six storeys beneath Frankâ€™s host Peckham Levels, which are open year-round: a galliÂ­maufry of international cuisine (mezze platters, Hawaiian poke, vegan pizza), a yoga centre, art and ceramics studios and Ghost Notes, a live-music bar. Tickets for the latest Hollywood releases and independent films at the ground-floor Peckhamplex cost a mere Â£4.99, less than half the price of cinema admission in Londonâ€™s West End. All in all, perhaps the absolute best use of a used car park anywhere, ever...

results.name: Lovely 1 bed Apartment Islington on Tube Stop
results.description: Located in Islington Studios this apartment is a 1 minute walk to Holloway Road Tube Station (Piccadilly Line), Arsenal Stadium & London Met Uni. Incredible access to transport. Close to Kings Cross, Angel, Old Street, Dalston. While Soho and Central London are just 15 minutes by tube, you may not find a reason to leave- the flat is surrounded by cafes, restaurants, pubs, and food shops a plenty in case you feel like dining in. results.neighborhood_overview:
Yes Arsenal Football Stadium is a stones throw away, but there's so much more too! The area is becoming a real foodie haven with the opening of great cafes, dirty burger, the chicken shop, italian pizzeria where there's always a queue, coffee roasters, a fabulous wine and cheese shop, delicious vietnamese, famous chinese, bakeries, plus there's always the long standing a great local pubs.
If it's shopping you're after, you're in luck! If the enormous amount of shops along Upper Street doesn't work for you, jump on the overland train to Westfield, or bus to Camden, or tube to Oxford Street!
There's a classic old cinema 10 minutes walk to Holloway, or walk towards Angel for the more snazzy Screen on the Green cinema (with sofas and a bar in the cinema!)

results.name: safe and spacious room in comfy family home
results.description:
We are looking forward to hosting you in our 100% covid-proof household. We are a cosmopolitan mother and son (19 years) team who enjoy sharing our lives and space with like-minded individuals while sticking to social distancing rules!
We are ideally located between the city and the countryside and well connected to buses, underground (Victoria Line) and train. Everything you need can easily be reached on foot or via a short bus ride (8-10 minutes).
results.neighborhood_overview:
We are a cosmopolitan family in a lovely neighbourhood nestled comfortably between the city and Epping Forest. Chingford Mount is a walking distance from our house with lovely restaurants, pubs, bars, and a great variety of shops.
We are a 15 minute bus ride (no. 34) away from Walthamstow Central (bus stop is at the bottom of the road) where the William Morris Gallery, Lloyd Park, and two fantastic landmark pubs - the Bell and the Rose & Crown (a vibrant theater incuded!) - await you.
From there you also have fast train and Underground connections to the City and London's Westend.

You can go for lovely walks along the nearby water reservoirs or you can hop on the 444 bus (directly in front of our house) which will take you all the way to Queen Elizabeth's Hunting lodge at the entrance to Epping Forest (25 minute ride).
results.host_about:
I am Senior Lecturer and Associate Head of Department (Languages) in the Faculty of Edcuation and Language Studies at the British Open University. I have been living in London for most of my adult life and feel very much at home here.
Having grown up in a vicarage back in Germany I am not only used to but throughly enjoy having people from all walks of life sharing my/our home. My husband, Huseyin, comes from a Turkish family where - like in many Mediterranean families - guests and visitors are not only always welcome but will be honoured and treated with respect.
We are both very much looking forward to being your hosts.

results.neighborhood_overview:
West Hampstead is, to all intents and purposes, just one street - West End Lane. It is located in the London Borough of Camden, in zone two of the London Underground. It borders Belsize Park/Finchley Road to the east, and Kilburn/Willesden to the west. In the north are Cricklewood and Golders Green, whilst to the south lie uber-refined St. John's Wood and Maida Vale. The area is home to three train stations (all, confusingly, called West Hampstead!) and is a bona fide yuppie stronghold.
Though West Hampstead is hardly a place that springs to mind when you think nightlife, it has a smattering of good restaurants, pubs and bars. On the whole, the area's watering holes are towards the swankier (and pricier) end of the spectrum, and places tend to feel more mature feel than, say, Camden Town.

In terms of nightclubs, Lately on West End Lane is a charming old-school dancing spot, whilst the Lower Ground Bar (also on West End Lane) flaunts its status as "West Hampstead's Premi

results.neighborhood_overview:
Over the past 10-15 years, Hackney has changed a lot. It used to be very poor, and indeed there still is a lot of poverty in places. But it is a vibrant, interesting neighbourhood, with a multi-cultural vibe, people of many ethnicities, plenty of families living here, and lots going on. It retains its 'urban grit' and cool edge.

We are located in travel Zone 2 which means not right next to the busy, noisy tourist traps, but in a place where it's fairly quick to get to central London and there is the space and beautiful garden instead! The full postcode is E9 6DW so you can see for yourself.

New cafes, bars, pubs and clubs have been springing up on our doorstep for some years or so and there are lots of nice restaurants nearby if you don't always want to travel into town. There are also City Farms, museums, and lovely walks along the canal and River Lea just 15 minutes' walk away.

There still is evidence of social problems which you can't really get aw
results.host_about: I'm a down-to-earth, friendly person who works on my own little social enterprise about cargo bikes.I love spending time with my family, cafes and coffee, enjoying the outdoors, and reading novels. I have enjoyed making my home comfy, quirky, cute & funky - I hope! I love living in my area of Hackney and very much enjoy welcoming guests to my place to enjoy London as much as I do. I hope I can show you the fun stuff that locals find and help you soak up the atmosphere. I have travelled to a few places in my time such as Iceland, Sri Lanka, Romania, Canada, Denmark and my favourite: South of France, but really I am a home girl at heart!

results.neighborhood_overview:
It is unique in so much as it is so close to the centre of London, but has a real feel of peace, quiet and country side. It is close to the river, where I regularly do a 7K run around the 2 bridges loop (takes about an hour to walk this), and Bishops Park is 5 mins away which has a lovely Farmers Market every Sunday morning. There is a great local pub, The Crabtree, on the river 5 mins walk away and a great little corner shop for all your basic shopping requirements. The famous River Cafe Restaurant is about a 10 minute walk away along the river and I can recommend many others.

Jump on a bus at the top of the road and you can arrive at the great museums of South Kensington within 20 minutes and Piccadilly Circus is 15 minutes on the tube once you get to Hammersmith.

results.neighborhood_overview: Brixton is now one of the UK's top destinations and has the UK's busiest nightlife. Brixton tube station is the second busiest in London and Brixton is recognised as one of the coolest places in London to visit by many tourists. The worldwide exclusive private club, worth an incredible 2.8 billion dollars, Soho House & Co., opened its first studio space south of the river in October 2021 and is literally a minute's walk from our flats. Undoubtedly, Brixton has established itself as the beating heart of London's culture of diversity.
results.host_about:
Hello, I'm a friendly Italian man with a positive outlook on life.

I am endlessly curious. I love to experience the world with eyes wide open. I never stop exploring, discovering and evolving.

Likewise, I love Science, the Arts, and creative people. Life to me is a storybook full of fascinating tales. I amass information 'on the hoof' and very little passes me by. Understanding what makes others tick is meat and drink to me and proves to be a source of endless joy.

I always keep my mind active. I love beauty in all forms, I am well-educated, and I like to remain totally classless. This makes it easy for me to get on with just about any sort of person. I am thought-provoking and even quite deep on occasions. I also get involved in other exciting things which keep me busy too, such as painting, reading books, newspaper and cultural magazines, photography, video editing, cycling, theatre, music, and movies.

Furthermore, I strongly believe a very clean, secure, welcoming feel, and comfortable apartment is of paramount importance for travellers.

My life's golden rule is to treat others as you wish to be treated!

I am always on an adventure. Enjoy hearing about people's travels and lifestyles.

You may want to know that I am a very responsive host, so if you encounter any issues while staying in my properties, I very much appreciate you to address them straight away and give me the chance to fix them.

Sincerely,

Adriano

Experience Old London in this large period double in a Victorian flat very close to the Chiswick House Park. Extra large desk. Private sitting area around an original magnificent Victorian fireplace. Super comfy king size bed and an artistic private ensuite Victorian bathroom.
Easy access to the M4 and Heathrow Airport, short walk to high street. Well connected to Central London via underground, train and buses.
Use of kitchen and washing machine.
Two friendly hosts and quirky cats, what more?
results.neighborhood_overview:
It's leafy Chiswick!!!
We are in a great central area, with easy access to Central London and the airport, both by car and with public transport (buses, train and tube are all at easy reach) and yet we are only 2 minutes' walk from the beautiful park Chiswick house and grounds!
The high street, only 10 minutes away, is packed with great and exclusive restaurants, as well as less expensive but very tasty little pizzerias and cafÃ©s.
results.host_about:
Hi, I'm quite new at this, let's see how it goes!
I'm a relaxed mosaic artist and I spend a lot of time in my studio down the garden making art. I also tend to travel a lot lately. I have two cats, but they are very independent and you don't really see them much in the flat, they love to wander around the surrounding gardens.
I am here to help you, if needed, but in general I prefer to respect people's privacy and independence.

results.name: Bright room on park near city 7
results.description:
Bright double room in beautifully renovated house, fronting large peaceful park in central London.

Very convenient for transport to key locations including West End, City, Canary Wharf, Greenwich (UNESCO site), O2 Arena, Excel and East London.
results.neighborhood_overview:
The area is very central, but relaxed due to facing Deptford Park across a very quiet street and in a lovely Victorian pocket. Located short walking distance to one of London's UNESCO world heritage listed sites: beautiful Maritime Greenwich (20 mins walk / 5 min bus) and London's second UNESCO site at the Tower of London (~35 minutes by foot / 15 minutes bus)

Deptford itself is very historic with Tudor era Royal Docks & diarists John Evelyn and Samuel Pepys, ancient churches & Watling Street. Deptford High Street has galleries, the great Deptford Project Cafe and vibrant market. We are very near Surrey Quays tube station, shopping centre and restaurants.
results.host_about:
Australian guy living with partner. 

I have been in London 9 years and know the city very well. Very happy to introduce you to it. I love the house and the area. We're really close to everything but very peaceful and green facing the park. 

I am a management consultant and professional investor. I did consulting for the oil industry for 3 years (including working in groovy places like Angola & Kuwait). I'm also an ex-lawyer and Science major. 

I love travel (40+ countries in the last 5 years) and meeting people. Really into snowboarding. Also economics and 20th Century History. 

We have a flatmate, who's great. 

Looking forward to meeting you and having you to stay!"

results.name: Spacious Double Room (R3)
results.description:
Welcome to Home2Home-Rooms Bed and Breakfast. Private Rooms available within a friendly shared apartment in Chiswick. We follow covid social distancing guidelines.

Sharing with other guests, two Shared Bathrooms & Shared Kitchen.

Children & Infants are welcome but are counted as a guest.

Checkin from 12-1pm /Checkout 10am
Self Checkin Available with pre-arranged (with Front Door Entry Code)
Early Luggage Drop-off available from 8am & Luggage storage available on day of checkout.
results.neighborhood_overview:
Chiswick High Street is a short walk away, with an abundance of available restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shops.

Chiswick offers riverside pubs, lovely parks and good schools, which all contribute to its overall charm: combining city life with village living. Chiswick has easy access to the M4 and all major routes in and out of London. Chiswick is also ideally positioned for short journeys to the West End, the City, and Heathrow Airport is fairly close.

Chiswicks transport links include underground stations such as Stamford Brook, Turnham Green, Chiswick Park and Gunnersbury.

Locally there is excellent shopping centre at Westfield - Shepherds Bush, the biggest shopping centre in London, which is a 10-15 minute tube or bus ride away. Notting Hill with its Portobello Market is a couple of miles away and Earls Court and Kensington Olympia Exhibition Centres are nearby too.
results.host_about: I am a 40 year old working mum with an amazing daughter who is my everything. I rent rooms in a bed and breakfast holiday apartment type accommodation and provide a Home2Home experience.

results.neighborhood_overview:
Ladywell Village is just that - a little village located within Central London. It has a very unique character, but it only takes 16 minutes to get to London Bridge (for Tate modern;Tower Bridge;Globe Theatre;The Tower of London;St Paul's Cathedral) and 22 minutes to Charing Cross (within walking distance of Trafalgar Square; The National Gallery and Portrait Gallery; Horseguards Parade (for the spectacular Horse mounted Changing of the Guard);10 Downing Street;Big Ben;Houses of Parliament;Westminster Abbey;Buckingham Palace and Tate Britain).

Ladywell station is less than 2 minutes walk, and the village itself has a lovely feel and some really great shops. Probably of most interest to visitors are the cafes and restaurants.There is a French Patisserie/cafe on the corner by the station with great croissants and Oscars, a little independent cafe with a tiny garden, where the German lady owner bakes all her own delicious cakes and great coffee. Cool room+wifi - Dalston Right in the heart of trendy East London - Dalston/Highbury/Islington. Lots of buses running virtually to the door that take you into the west end or East London. Dalston Junction is a short walk as is Canonbury overground. I am currently sharing with a journalist who specialises in education.

results.host_about:
Hi, my name is Janina.   I am from a creative background - film, photography,  art and design.   It is usually just myself in the house, but I do rent out another room as well,  so if you book you would be sharing with myself and also one other airbnb guest.   

Born in London, I have lived in most areas of it and am available to ask any questions about where to go, what to do and where to eat etc.

I am near Dalston (which Vogue recently voted the trendiest area in the world!!!  I dunno about that but it is full of arty types, shops and is a great mix of styles and cultures. ) There is a brilliant bus route that goes all night and stops just outside the door (well give or take a few feet) and there are various tubes to get you anywhere.  

I love meeting new people and am more than happy to help with advice about London .

results.neighborhood_overview:
I love living in Morden it is a wonderful place. We have Morden Park right behind us which is lovely in (URL HIDDEN) has a Swimming Baths, childrens's playground, walking track (running around the outside) and is a large open space of grass dotted with small groups of trees. I enjoy watching all the wildlife that comes into the garden and listening to the birds singing in the morning.

Morden is a very safe place with a very low crime rate. We have local shops at Grandrive which includes a Co Op supermarket, a cafe, post office, hair dressers and dog groomers. Morden town center is the other end of our road with Morden Underground (Norther Line) and Bus station. Morden has many shops including Sainsbury, Lidl, Iceland supermarkets, Boots and Superdrug chemists, a dry-cleaners and many places to eat.

One of the nicest place in Morden is Morden Hall Park. It has a lovely rose garden and for wasting an afternoon with a picnic it is just the perfect spot. It also has

results.neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush is undergoing a massive amount of regeneration and rejuvenation. Westfield Shopping centre is in the second phase of its expansion which will open - late 2018. The BBC Television is also being redeveloped into a Hotel/Entertainment complex and University London Research Complex including campus is also in the process of being completed!

results.name: Chelsea Studio by Kings Road London
results.neighborhood_overview:
South Kensington is home to major museum's, with the beautifully gilded Natural History Museum and the Victoria & Albert Museum. Royal Albert Hall is the UK's most famous concert hall, just a 20 minute walk or 10 minute bus away from Draycott Place.

Sloane Square is a shopping centre for Brits, with two major streets. Kings Road is more low key with several small parks, a short walk to the river Thames, the Saatchi Gallery, and has your more interesting stores such as Vivian Westwood, Antropology, LK Bennett, Bimba y Lola, plus great dining and nightlife. Sloane Street has all of your D&G, Prada, Hackett, Marni, ending up near Harrod's of Knightsbridge.

Knightsbridge gives to the south of Hyde Park, which is also a great place for walking, biking, horseback, or just enjoying tea overlooking the Serpentine pond. Enjoy the West London living experience.

American ex-Pat enjoying Europe.

results.name: Five minute walk to South Bank
results.description:
This is a clean and private room in Central London, with your own key, in a shared apartment.

The room has; a double bed (small) closet to hang clothes, soft sofa chair, fold down desk and chair to work. Cleanliness is a priority.

Waterloo and Southwark underground are a few minutes away. London Eye and Big Ben are a 10 minutes walk from the apartment. Your room locks and you will have your own keys. The apartment is situated on the first floor within a quiet and secure apartment block.
results.neighborhood_overview: This is central London.
